pullrequest.title: Word-wrapping in treeviews and item views, adapted from David Meyer's implementation.

content.raw:
So I did some testing and functionally I think it is OK.

For some reason I seem to have a different \(monospaced?\) font now for the first two columns, and a lot of extra padding, which I’m not a big fan of. The last two columns remain with the traditional font though. Not sure if this is something odd with our control PC though as none of the screenshots above have this change visible…

The extra padding has also affected the “Groups” tab, which now makes our list of groups not fit on one 1080p screen.

Other odd things:

* You can’t use the arrow keys to reach the “<Click to add global>” entry \(actually this was a bug previously…you can only reach it if focus is in the name column…maybe this is not fixable\)
* The “<Click to add global>” entry is the original font
* I think it would be good if the “Expansion” column at least had a minimum size of the “Outer” text \+ icon so that it didn’t jump around when you scan parameter space \(obviously will still jump around for zip groups\)

The last two columns remain with the traditional font though. Not sure if this is something odd with our control PC though as none of the screenshots above have this change visible…

The extra padding has also affected the “Groups” tab, which now makes our list of groups not fit on one 1080p screen.

Other odd things:
